page.title: 06The Farmer's Day
page.content: The farmer gets up early at 4.30am to milk the cows.At the finish of the milking the farmer feeds the cows with silage,barley,maize and molasses.The baby calves are then fed on a milk replacer.The farmer then goes to the{ mill to prepare food for the following day.In late winter and early spring ploughing and tilling are done. Spring is a very busy time on the farm.The ewes usually lamb during March and April and the shepherd has to be there to help any ewe who cannot have her lamb without some help.During late Spring and the early summer months the first cut of silage is made. Silage is grass which is cut and stored and is fed to animals during the winter months.Silage can be made even if the weather is wet. Then he checks his stock.
